intro: Pegolettia anol, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers bloom in clusters. Pegolettia anol is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
